showScoreExcerpt:
I connected with the perspectives of these characters, the kinds of questions they asked, and the quirkiness of their dreams. As a neurodivergent theatre artist, I felt that these words, these fixations, these slightly incorrectly nuanced big picture ideas all felt very true to my real life experience. If the creative team had let the cast be a little more themselves, a little less awkward, it would go a long way toward neurotypical audience members embracing the show.
